descriptionHTML:
Use your Android Wear or Pebble smart watch to control your presentations.

NOTE: For wireless smart watch control you must have an Android Wear or a Pebble with at least version 2.0 firmware.

Easily control your presentations wirelessly with your smart watch. A quick glance at your watch and you will instantly know what slide you are on and how many slides you have left. Change slides by pressing the previous/next buttons on the Android Wear screen or the top/bottom buttons on the right side of the Pebble.

Connect to Google Drive to access your presentations. Currently, PDF, Google Drive presentations, and raw image formats are supported.

To add raw image presentations, choose the "Enable image presentations" menu option for each Drive account. This will create a "Wrist Presenter" folder. Create a subfolder for each raw image presentation and upload the images into it on Google Drive. The folder name will be used for the presentation name and images will be ordered alphabetically based on their file names.

When offline, any previously opened PDF or raw image presentations will be available. This makes it possible to use your presentations at conferences where network connectivity is often poor to nonexistent.

View your presentations on a projector with a Chromecast, Miracast (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00H2D3N0M/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il?ie=UTF8&camp=1789&creative=9325&creativeASIN=B00H2D3N0M&linkCode=as2&tag=slacod-20), or an HDMI adapter (http://www.amazon.com/LinkS-Slimport-Adapter-optimus-infinity/dp/B00F8FGSOE/ref=pd_sim_e_6&tag=slacod-20) on compatible devices.

Wrist Presenter is run by fellow smart watch enthusiasts Matthew Morey and Andy Dyer. Please send all bugs and feature requests to support@wristpresenter.com.
